content: umpkin number on a free knitting pattern by ewelina wojsz designs size s one size only h=5 cm 2 w= 8 5 cm 3¼ gauge n/a needles double-pointed needles 2 5 mm us 1½ / uk yarn nord by drops 50 g 1 8 oz = approx 170 m 186 yds about 12 g 0 42 oz additionally 1 stitch marker a pair of scissors a darning needle a long one some polyester stuffing 1 coconut shell button 15 mm ½ a sharpened piece of stick 40 x 7 mm 1½ x ¼ a hot glue gun with a glue stick umpkin number on a free knitting pattern by ewelina wojsz designs https //www instagram com/ewelinawojszdesigns/ 1 essential skills ✗ cast on ✗ knit in the round on dpns ✗ purl difficulty level beginner abbreviations ✗ k knit ✗ p purl ✗ rs right side ✗ st s stitch es ✗ ws wrong side opywright notic this free knitting pattern is the property of ewelina wojsz ewelina wojsz designs and is for personal use only you cannot modify sell or share this pattern you can sell finished items handmade from this pattern made in a limited number my dream is to build a friendly and supportive knitting community that celebrates both the knitting process and the finished item therefore please share your progress on social media with #pumpkinnumberone and tag me with @ewelinawojszdesigns so i could keep track of your knits <3 thank you for respecting me and my work umpkin number on a free knitting pattern by ewelina wojsz designs https //www instagram com/ewelinawojszdesigns/ 2 introductory | comments pumpkin number one is a project worked in the round on 2 5 mm us 1½ / uk double-pointed knitting needles it features a combination of knits and purls only so it is a very beginner-friendly project that will help you make use of your scrap yarn this pattern is written for one size only but to make a bigger pumpkin you could just use a thicker yarn and larger knitting needles tip just get your yarn and pick a bit smaller knitting needles size than what the yarn label suggests this way sts would be dense enough not to let the filling stick though them and follow the knitting instructions in the same exact way alright | let s begin cast on 60 sts 15 sts per needle on 2 5 mm us 1½ / uk double-pointed knitting needles with your preferred cast-on method leaving at least a 15 cm 6 long tail join to knit in the round making sure that the cast-on edge is not twisted and attach a stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round round 1 k all sts round 2 *k9 p1* repeat from * to * until the end of the round following rounds work in the established pattern until the end of round 46 or until the tube measures 12 cm 4¾ fiy if you are using thicker yarn and larger
